document_data.name: Avernus Survival Guide
document_data.author: [[Haskinn Xhesilaphin]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Avernus Survival Guide''''' was a [[book]] about the art of [[alchemy]] and the Part V of the ''Basics of Alchemy'' series penned by [[Haskinn Xhesilaphin]], a [[dragonborn]] alchemist sometime before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|''To combat the spiritual perils, the company of a cleric is of paramount importance: to soothe those swayed by the plane's evil influence, or to consecrate the corpses of those who succumb.''|Excerpt from ''Avernus Survival Guide.''}}
document_data.Content: One of the book's chapters was titled ''On Traversing the First Layer'' and described the grim unwelcoming landscape of the [[Avernus]], the first layer of [[Baator]] â€“ stretches of desolate barren rocky land menaced by a black sky, cut across with rivers of blood. The author echoed common guidance for those brave or stupid enough to venture into the Hells: "turn around and run."
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, copies of ''Avernus Survival Guide'' were sold at [[The Bibliophile]] book shop in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] by its proprietress, [[Nansi Gretta]].
document_data.Notable Owners: *[[Mystic Carrion]], a [[mummy lord]] inhabiting Baldur's Gate in the late 15{{th}} century DR.
